website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS is an older lens that lacks STM focusing capability, but is still a step up from your D-SLR's standard kit lens.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Lens, Great Range
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens to go with a new camera body, and have been extremely happy with its performance. At 18mm, I can take a full body image of a person standing three feet in front of me, while zooming out to 135mm allows amazing clarity and focus on far-away items. The focus is fast and quiet, and the lens is intuitive. This is a great all-around lens for someone that only wants to use one lens on their camera, and shoot in multiple areas.
customer_reviews.author: Double E

customer_reviews.title: A great lens for perfect 35mm shots...Must buy for all DSLR owners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to improve my range and image quality over the stock lenses - 18-55mm and 75-300mm and the result was visible from the first shot onwards. As with any IS/AF lens, it amazingly fast on focus and handles very well in moving object. I am a pilot and the IS feature is must have for me and believe me compared to Nikon's VR, Canon is a lot better, but that's just my opinion. One suggestion I give it on all my reviews on lenses is to purchase a good quality UV filter to go with it. I also have a lens hood for this lens. These will really protect the lens and you will thank me later :))
customer_reviews.author: DWB-Home

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a clear notice with the Stabilizer ON and OFF!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I received this Lens on February 27, 2013. A great lens, a big update for me from my previous 2 lenses for my Canon 30D. I had the original lens it came with, EFS 18-55mm and a lens which I bought along with it a year later, EF 75-300mm III USM; both are not IS !!!!! Stabilization makes a big difference!!! Even when your hand is shaking a little it helps tremendously! For $300 this was a no-brainer to get immediately!!! If anything happens to this lens I will update! If no updates, means this lens is working superbly! Hope this helps! p.s. It is no more heavier than my second lens; does not bother me!
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: I received this lens as a Mother's Day present. I had been wanting it for quite awhile and was so excited to put it on and start using it. Over the last several months this lens has not left my camera. I absolutely love it and would recommend it to anyone. I've taken all sorts of shots with it and have not been disappointed with it's performance. I'm not a professional, and I am sure there are other reviews that are far more technical than mine, but if you're like me and you just want a nice lens with a good range this completely fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: KateR

customer_reviews.title: Good lens, but...
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this is a great lens if you're beginning in photography. I mean, who wants to spend more when you don't even know you'll keep with photography? I sure don't, so I bought this lens. I have used this one a lot and I'll use it more. The only reason I give it 3 stars is that it's so freaking heavy. Holding this thing for 300+ shots for a photo shoot, you're going to feel it afterwards. I do wish that I skipped this one and bought the 85mm f/1.8 instead. I do portrait photography, so the 85mm would work better for me than this one. I like fixed lenses more than I like zoom.
customer_reviews.author: CJCR

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: This is a kit lens for some models of Canon DLSR. It work just for what I need and not breaking the bank, It's just wide enough and telephoto as well. It's not the fastest lens out there etc. If you wanna have an in between lens I would say this is a great lens. I think you would/will enjoy it as long as you know what your buying. Don't expect a $1,000.00 or more out of this lens , but again will more then do the job everyday shots of the kids,events etc.
customer_reviews.author: Charles G. Silas

customer_reviews.title: This is truly an amazing lens. It has a very practical range from ...
customer_reviews.text: This is truly an amazing lens. It has a very practical range from a fairly wide angle to a nice medium telephoto zoom. I know there is a USM version of this lens that is faster. Check the other USM one too see if it works for your budget before you buy this one. The USM version should give you faster response and more versatility. Enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: Bulut Nesimoglu

customer_reviews.title: Good option.
customer_reviews.text: I have the 18-55 lense that came with my camera and later bought a 70-300mm lense. This lense, 18-135 is right in the middle. Perfect for family get-togethers. Excellent lense.
customer_reviews.author: alharris

customer_reviews.title: a good every lense
customer_reviews.text: I brought this lense for a trip. I like it. It is a good every day lense. It cover from wide to tele. this way you don't have to carry a lot of different lense on a trip.
customer_reviews.author: rj chao

customer_reviews.title: Great Product & Service
customer_reviews.text: This lens is just right for my needs and comes with a great price. It's a "white-box" product but don't let that discourage you or make you apprehensive about buying. It's never been used and is in perfect condition. Due to me needing the product within a week, I paid a little extra for expedited shipping. The store sent it the same day and I got in in two days. Very impressive service!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: My wife had been looking for a better lens at an affordable price, this is it! When she would take pictures with the stock lens 5 out of 10 pics would be blurry. With this lens 1 out of 10, great for the beginner photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Carl P. Heinrichsmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very good standard lens, for close and mid-range zoom situations.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Richards

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I need
customer_reviews.text: My new Canon Rebel SL1 was a Christmas gift and it came without a len kit. I checked on line for a recommeded upgrade from the starter kit and found the EF-S 18-135mm and it gives me such a great range of photos to take from close up to zoom in on large landscaping photos. Very clear and focused pictures. I'm a newbie with SLR cameras but very happy with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Real good lens.
customer_reviews.text: This lens works pretty well on my 60D. and the price was RIGHT. White box is fine. Lens is brand new and you get all the warrenties and instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Musical Snob

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: use on our Rebel Xti. Very nice lens. Solid performance so far. Like the range it has for an all around lens to keep on for everyday shooting. No problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D. Holton

customer_reviews.title: Nice Economy grade Lens
customer_reviews.text: Use this on Canon Rebel T3 with great success. Takes great pictures for the price. I have been complimented for my pictures with lens. Not as sharp as professional grade lenses, but neither is it that expensive. Image stabilization does a wonderful job as well, but wont stop the motion is action photos. Lens creep not an issue, but it almost creeps from gravity (pointing lens down to the ground).
customer_reviews.author: CShooter

customer_reviews.title: Canon EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Standard Zoom Lens -NEW KIT WHITE BOX
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my Canon camera. Disappointed that it was a Korean manufacturer. Would have preferred a Japanese manufactured device.
customer_reviews.author: stan the man

customer_reviews.title: Canon Lens
customer_reviews.text: The item was as advertised, and arrive on time and in great shape. I would deal with this company again in the future
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Causey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens has been perfect for shooting senior portraits and and engagement photos. The lens works just like any other cannon, only it came in a white box, but I don't care what kind of box the lens comes in. I care about the quality of the lens, and this happens to be my favorite new lens.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around lens.
customer_reviews.text: Good for indoors and (limited usage because of short telephoto) outdoors. Glad I bought it. Have gotten good photos when using it.
customer_reviews.author: CARL J. MARCHESE

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this lens. It is better than I expected it to be. Pictures are very sharp and I use it as my every day lens on a Canon 60D. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Krall

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens
customer_reviews.text: Good lens for getting wide angle shots. Even though it is not a wide angle lens, will do the trick! Great lens for the price!
customer_reviews.author: N Mil

customer_reviews.title: Canon 18-135
customer_reviews.text: Great lens for photo and landscape. This is a great lens it you are not going to take a lot of long range shots. If you do not have a 18-135 spend a litle more money and buy the 18-200mm.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Using 18-135 for normal lens
customer_reviews.text: After the automatic focus on my normal lens (18-55) quit working, I shopped for another lens for my Canon Rebel XSi. Canon quoted me $98 to fix the lens. I have a 55-250 telephoto, but it is too big to use for a regular lens. It was then that I discovered the Canon 18-135 (f/3.5-5.6) on Amazon--which I purchased last month. I would rather have a faster lens, but they are twice the cost. So, I have used the new lens in various situations--soccer games, in meetings, scenery, etc. It does an adequate job.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne E. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for the item
customer_reviews.text: haven't really had the opportunity to get real use out of this lens yet. I am sure it will be great and it was a great price. I had been looking for a while and was glad to find it
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A. Morse

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. Got a great deal on Amazon. The lens works well for my amateur level use. Not too fancy but great for amateurs.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Canon 18-135mm - A great all rounder
customer_reviews.text: I have had the 18-55mm kit lens and the 55-250mm. But, with this lens, I don't think ill ever use the other two. If you plan to buy a new Canon camera, i would recommend buying this as the kit lens. The only flip-side being, its bit heavier than the other two.
customer_reviews.author: Rohan

customer_reviews.title: canon 18-135mmmm is lens
customer_reviews.text: this lens is a good lens,but not dependable.With the first copy it was a problem with focus,the second copy,problem with colors.This can be a beautiful lens,if you find a good copy,but if you are buying it, make sure it's says 18-135mm is ud(for good colors).I returned the second copy also,no patience.
customer_reviews.author: H. R. ULYSSE

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Great walk around camera. Nice range and solid build for the price. Still learning the best focal distance and aperture to keep this on for general use, but the pictures are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for shooting in bright light... pathetic for using in dark
customer_reviews.text: The lens is great when compared to the 18-55 kit lens - helps avoid changing your lens too often. The range is good enough for most situations. It is heavier than the kit lens but not too heavy to carry around. On the negative side, the lens is pathetic when shooting at night or in dark conditions - the images are very very grainy and unrecognizabale
customer_reviews.author: V. A.

customer_reviews.title: Canon EF-S 18-135mm
customer_reviews.text: Great standard lens to have!!! Quality is not that bad either, more than I expected. A+ seller and transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M. Young

customer_reviews.title: It's a toy
customer_reviews.text: It's a toy and it doesn't come with a hood, like the sigma 18-200 which is an awesome lens much better than this toy, plastic, junck.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent L. Degennaro

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!
customer_reviews.text: This lens has a phenomenal zoom range. Above average optics (as good or better than the kit). A stellar price. Image Stabilization. It doesn't weigh very much. This all adds up to a spectacular travel lens. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: thedom

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Hi! I got the item very quickly. It looks good enough, works as expected without any troubles. Thanks you, guys!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

product_meta.title: Canon 18-135mm f/5.6-38 for Canon EF-S Cameras Standard-Zoom Lens Fixed Zoom White Box (Bulk Packaging)
product_meta.description: Covering a range from 29mm-216mm in 35mm format, Canon's new EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 IS offers a winning combination of size, range and features and is a perfect complement to APS-C cameras. With high-quality optics, dedicated image stabilization and more, this new lens promises to be a favorite for EOS users.
feature_bullets: EF-S Mount for APS-C Format EOS Cameras
Bulk Packaging Come in White box use with card

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars49 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
